root: ^Just sir! Do not address the subgnome, human!
^And would it kill you to bring me a menu?!
^(I go grab two menus, and bring it back over to the top gnome angrily stomping his foot...)
^I appreciate the gift, human, but I have no need for a second menu.
^Well, what can I get you... gentlegnomes?
^Gentle? Are you saying I have gone soft?!
^And what did I say about addressing Hograt?!
^Not that it matters to you, human, but my partner below me is known as Hograt.
^("Partner" sounds a bit too generous for how he's been acting...)
^Please do not address Hograt, his lesser IQ makes him more susceptible to distractions.
^(This dude needs to be humbled, desperately.)
^Well, what can I get for you anyways?
^I shall be taking your finest slice of Lingonberry Sweet Pie.
^I will take it freshly made piping hot, not that "reheating" trick you humans like to do.
^Have it done and served in less than ten minutes, understood?
^Surely this... "Fine" establishment can handle a simple pie, yes?
^(I head back into the kitchen and grab a frozen Lingonberry Sweet Pie slice, and heat them up in the microwave.)
^(I rummage around the spices for a bit, before finding...)
^(I take some, and carefully season the slice of pie with it...)
^(I head out of the kitchen, and place the seasoned slice of pie in front of Himber.)
^What took you so long? Do you have no care for your paying patrons?! I'm famished!
^(He stabs through the slice with his fork, and gulps it all down without even chewing!)
^Are you sure Hograt doesn't want anything?
^Well, now that you mention it, it is around time for his weekly morsel.
^Do you happen to possess any ground up ore? If not, any finely carved granite will do.
^(I look down at Hograt, and he looks back at me, excited.)
^Oh, uh, okay then... I'll see what I can find!
^(I head to the kitchen and poke around, trying not to disturb Chef Swatts.)
^(Jeez, if he found out I was serving rocks...)
^(Where the hell am I gonna find Granite?!)
^(I go back to the storage closet.)
^(I see an old table, broken into pieces.)
^(I take a chunk, put it on a plate, and bring it out to Hograt.)
^(I hand the plate to Hograt, who has his hands outstretched.)
^(He gently takes it, and shoves the whole thing in his mouth--plate and all!)
^Yes, thank you human! Hograt is most pleased with your service!
^Well, I'm glad he's enjoying it... Somehow...
^Yes, subgnomes are quite fond of ores and other aggregates of mineral.
^As you can tell, Granite is among Hograt's favorites. Isn't that right, Hograt?
^(Hograt nods and smiles with his teeth. Those things look like they could cut through diamonds...)
^(I guess he really does enjoy it? But I'm still confused on the... relationship... going on here...)
^Well... Is there anything else I can get for you?
^No, this will do nicely. Thank you, human.
^(Himber drops a handful of gold coins onto the table, and motions for Hograt to exit the booth.)
^(Hograt walks out of the diner, with Himber standing tall on top of him.)
